column4: hey all. I'm new. How do I find the software that i downloaded through synaptic?
a specific app. I downloaded conky and can't find it.
nothing special, I dont see it
is there a way to do like Mac OS and make all the windows show up?
more specifically?
Compiz can do the same thing and more. I use it myself on a regular basis as a Mac and Linux dualbooter
like if I move the mouse to a corner of a screen and all the windows show up in equally laid out spaces
yup, you can do EXACTLY that. sudo apt-get install compizconfig-settings-manager
thanks, i'll give it a shot.
no probs. If you have any questions about how to set it up, i'm happy to help :)
it didn't open it up. it said: E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11: Resource temporarily unavailable)
Are you installing updates or new software?
(You can't install two programs at once)
ah yes. lol.
i'm doing an "apply change" and it's been taking a while.
what are you installing/upgrading?
I think it's a total system update
ah yeah, if you haven't done them in a while (or ever) they can take a little while :)
it would be a first time. I just built this PC yesterday and loaded ubuntu.
alright, it's started. now what?
compiz-config is?
actually....no it isn't. lol. hold on
ok i think I can handle a GUI lol. thanks again.
:D yeah, the plugin you'll want to use is called "Expo", and make sure to look at "Edge bindings" (screen edges). good luck!
